title: How to Change Mouse Sensitivity on Windows

steps.title: Click Windows Start menu and select Settings.
steps.content: Click Windows Start menu and select Settings . It’s usually at the bottom-left corner of the Start menu.

steps.title: Click Devices.
steps.content: Click Devices . You'll see this icon near the top of the window.

steps.title: Click Mouse & touchpad.
steps.content: Click Mouse & touchpad . It’s near the center of the left column.

steps.title: Click Additional mouse options.
steps.content: Click Additional mouse options . It’s the blue link beneath the “Related settings” header. This opens the Mouse Properties panel to the Buttons tab. If you're on another tab, click Buttons so you can find the options to adjust the sensitivity of the double-click feature.

steps.title: Use the slider to change the speed.
steps.content: Use the slider to change the speed. If you want to increase or decrease the rate at which a double-click is registered, use the “Speed” slider.

steps.title: Click the Pointer Options tab.
steps.content: Click the Pointer Options tab. You'll see it at the top of the window.

steps.title: Drag the “Motion” slider to the desired speed.
steps.content: Drag the “Motion” slider to the desired speed. A higher speed increases sensitivity, while a lower speed enhances precision.

steps.title: Enable (or disable) enhanced pointer precision.
steps.content: Enable (or disable) enhanced pointer precision. Pointer precision lets the mouse movement match the speed of your hand on the mouse (or your finger on the trackpad). Check the box if you want to enable this feature, or remove the check to disable it.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Your mouse sensitivity is now adjusted.
